briefTitle: Pivotal Trial of Dermagraft(R) to Treat Venous Leg Ulcers
officialTitle: A Prospective, Multi-Center, Randomized, Controlled Clinical Investigation of Dermagraft(R) in Subjects With Venous Leg Ulcers DEVO-Trial
summary: This study randomly assigns patients with venous leg ulcers to receive standard therapy (compression) alone or compression plus Dermagraft(R). Dermagraft is a device containing live human fibroblasts grown on an absorbable Vicryl mesh. Patients are seen weekly until they heal or the 16-week treatment period is complete. Follow-up visits are conducted monthly for three months in order to assess patients for longer term safety.

primaryOutcome.measure: Complete Healing of the Study Ulcer by Week 16.
